skill.name: packmol
skill.description: This skill should be used when the user asks to "create a packmol input", "pack molecules with packmol", "solvate a protein", "build an initial configuration", "setup molecular dynamics", or discusses molecular packing, solvation, or building simulation starting structures.
skill.summary: This skill should be used when the user asks to "create a packmol input", "pack molecules with packm...
skill.author: Chenghao-Wu

security_audit.summary: Legitimate scientific tool for molecular dynamics simulation preparation. Static analyzer flagged documentation examples and coordinate syntax as security issues. All findings are false positives: README command examples were misidentified as shell execution, molecular coordinates were flagged as path traversal, and the random seed parameter was misidentified as cryptography. No malicious intent, credential access, or data exfiltration detected.

content.value_statement: Building initial molecular structures for simulations requires precise spatial constraints. Packmol automates molecule placement with overlap prevention, supporting boxes, spheres, cylinders, and planes for diverse simulation needs.
actual_capabilities: Generate Packmol input files programmatically from Python
Validate input syntax before running Packmol
Solvate proteins with water and ions automatically
Check output PDB files for atomic overlaps
limitations: Packmol software must be installed separately via pip
Requires existing molecule structure files (PDB, XYZ, or TINKER format)
Does not perform actual molecular dynamics simulation
Limited to predefined constraint types supported by Packmol

use_cases.title: Protein solvation setup
use_cases.description: Solvate biomolecules with water and ions for MD simulation preparation

use_cases.title: Interface system building
use_cases.description: Create liquid-liquid or liquid-vapor interfaces using plane constraints

use_cases.title: Molecular packing basics
use_cases.description: Learn to pack simple molecular boxes with multiple molecule types

prompt_templates.title: Basic box packing
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Packmol input file to pack 1000 water molecules in a 40x40x40 Angstrom box with 2.0 Angstrom tolerance

prompt_templates.title: Protein solvation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a Packmol input file to solvate protein.pdb with 5000 water molecules, 10 Na+ ions, and 10 Cl- ions using 15 Angstrom solvent shell

prompt_templates.title: Interface system
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an input file for a water/chloroform interface with PBC at z=-30 to 30, placing 1000 water below plane and 200 chloroform above plane

prompt_templates.title: Automated solvation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use solvate_helper.py to generate a complete Packmol solvation input for my protein with 15 Angstrom shell, +4 charge, and 0.15 M salt concentration

output_examples.input: Create a Packmol input file to pack 500 water molecules and 100 ethanol molecules in a 50x50x50 box
output: Output will be written to: mixture.pdb
Configuration: tolerance=2.0, 500 water molecules, 100 ethanol molecules, box 0-50 Angstrom

output_examples.input: Solvate a protein with 20 Angstrom water shell
output: Added 8 Na+ and 4 Cl- for charge neutralization
Created solvation.inp with complete solvation setup

best_practices: Start with small test systems (10-50 molecules) before scaling up
Validate input files with validate_input.py before running Packmol
Set a random seed (e.g., seed 12345) for reproducible results
Check output for overlaps using check_overlaps.py after packing
anti_patterns: Running Packmol without validating input syntax first
Using a tolerance value smaller than 1.5 Angstrom for all-atom models
Skipping overlap checks on output structures before simulations
Creating very large systems without using restart files

faq.question: Is Packmol installed with this skill?
faq.answer: No. Install separately with: pip install packmol

faq.question: What molecule file formats are supported?
How many molecules can Packmol handle?
faq.answer: Practical limit is around 100,000 atoms. Use restart files for larger systems.

faq.question: Does this skill run Packmol or just generate inputs?
faq.answer: The skill generates input files. Run Packmol separately with: packmol < input.inp

faq.question: Can I check if my output has problems?
faq.answer: Use scripts like check_overlaps.py to verify atomic distances and analyze_density.py for density.

faq.question: How is this different from other MD setup tools?
faq.answer: Packmol focuses on initial structure packing. Use with GROMACS or AMBER for force field setup and energy minimization.
